newsitem.title: USA: Leslie Fay says to emerge from bankruptcy.
newsitem.headline: Leslie Fay says to emerge from bankruptcy.

text.p: Leslie Fay Companies Inc said on Monday it expects to emerge from bankruptcy in May following the reorganization of its business.

The reorganization plan, confirmed by a U.S. bankruptcy court judge, provides for the company to emerge from chapter 11 by separating its Sassco Fashions business from its core Leslie Fay businesses and through the issuance of equity and notes of its new entities to creditors, the company said in a statement.
Once the plan is complete, the company added, Leslie Fay's current equity will be extinguished.
Leslie Fay manufactures women's apparel. After its separation, Sassco Fashions will make women's suits under the Kasper for A.S.L. and Albert Nipon brand names, the company said.
